com.qtplaf.library.task

Class TaskRunnerThreads

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.qtplaf.library.task.TaskRunner
      • com.qtplaf.library.task.TaskRunnerThreads
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Task, java.lang.Runnable

    public class TaskRunnerThreads
extends TaskRunner
    A task made of multiple tasks that are executed in concurrent threads. The tasks to be executed must correctly manage the TaskListener idiom.

    There are three possible execution scenarios:

    1. One or more tasks are indeterminate. The number of records is not known and the overall number of steps will be the number of tasks to execute.
    2. No task is indeterminate, but one or more does not support countSteps(). The total number of steps changes as tasks are being started and notify their number of steps.
    3. No task is indeterminate and all support countSteps(). An initital count is made on every task.
    Author:
    Miquel Sas

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      (package private) static class  TaskRunnerThreads.NotifyStrategy

      The comparator to sort processes by currentStep count ascending.

      • countSteps

        public long countSteps()
        If the task is determinate, a call to this method forces counting (and storing) the number of steps. If the task is not derteminate, this method has no sense.

        Steps are counted if the overall process is determinate.

        Returns:
        The number of steps.

      • processStepCount

                       throws java.lang.Exception
        Process step count when notify strategy is StepsKnown.

      • checkCancel

        protected boolean checkCancel()
        Convenience method to deal with cancel requests when cancel is supported. Usage: at the begining of the main loop, if check break the loop.

        if (checkCancel()) break;

        Overrides:
        checkCancel in class TaskRunner
        Returns:
        A boolean indicating that cancel has been accepted and processing should terminate.

      • checkPause

        protected boolean checkPause()
        Convinience method to deal with pause/resume requests when pause/resume is supported. Usage: at the begining of the main loop, if check continue.

        if (checkPause()) continue;

        Overrides:
        checkPause in class TaskRunner
        Returns:
        A boolean indicating that pause has been accepted and processing should pause.

      • isCancelSupported

        public boolean isCancelSupported()
        Returns a boolean indicating whether the task will support cancel requests. Cancel is supported if all tasks to be executed support cancel.
        Returns:
        A boolean.

      • isIndeterminate

        public boolean isIndeterminate()
        Returns a boolean indicating if the task is indeterminate, that is, the task can not count its number of steps. This concurrent task is indeterminate is always determinate.
        Returns:
        A boolean indicating if the task is indeterminate.

      • isPauseSupported

        public boolean isPauseSupported()
        Returns a boolean indicating whether the task will support the pause/resume requests. Pause/resume is supported if all tasks to be executed support pause/resume.
        Returns:
        A boolean.

      • isCountStepsSupported

        public boolean isCountStepsSupported()
        Returns a boolean indicating if the task supports counting steps through a call to countSteps(). This task supports it if the notify strategy is StepsKnown.
        Returns:
        A boolean.
